article:
A 'stun belt' is a belt that is fastened around the subject's waist, leg, or arm
that carries a battery and control pack, and contains features to stop the
subject from unfastening or removing it. A remote-control signal is sent to tell
the control pack to give the subject an electric shock. Some models are
activated by the subject's movement.

These devices are used to control prisoners in the United States. One type is
the REACT belt (see below). Some stun belts can restrain the subject's hands and
have a strap going under the subject's groin to stop him from rotating the belt
around the subject's waist and trying to deactivate it. Stun belts are not
generally available to the public.
